fields.summary: Unreliable ELB service when random ASG instances are terminated

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
In the current workflow, when an ELB VM fails for any reason, the entire workflow fails. This is problematic when there are multiple VMs for each ELB for fault-tolerance reason. The workflows should --
 1) Retry after masking the failed VM 
 2) The masked Vm should be terminated so that a new VM can replace the failed one.
fields.summary: Add retry and recycling to ELB workflows

comments.body:
The fix is to address a faulty ELB VM(servo). To verify, trigger any failure scenario to the ELB VM (such as crashing load-balancer-servo python process, killing Java process, stopping Redis server, bring down network interface). Then after a few minutes, the ELB VM should be automatically terminated and the new VM should replace the faulty one. Meanwhile, eulb-describe-instance-health will return <Unknown> for all instances until the new VM comes in.

If for any reason a user doesn't want this automatic VM recycling, there is a new property <services.loadbalancing.worker.failure_threshold_for_recycle>. When it is set to 0, the faulty VM remains in the system until manually cleaned up by cloud admin.The property's value is 24 by default, which means if there are 24 failures within an hour, the VM will be terminated. 

Note that this fix may introduce disruption to users' application because ELB service terminates a Vm when control traffics are faulty while data traffic *may* be still good through haproxy. In production deployment, the issue may be relieved with multiple VMs per ELB.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25788.147.20170202git6e5a63d.el7}}

*Steps*

# Created multi-cluster Eucalyptus VPC cloud - [hspencer-400-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/400/]
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones --region euca-admin@
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-dollar	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-market	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	port-of-miami	available
{code}
# Created non-eucalyptus account (example - {{development-operations}})
# Bundle, uploaded and registered Ubuntu Xenial HVM EMI:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-images --region devops-admin@
IMAGE	emi-63ef779d	ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-20170203/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000727120439	available	public	x86_64	machine		instance-store	hvm
{code}
# Set {{services.loadbalancing.worker.keyname}} cloud property:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euctl services.loadbalancing.worker.keyname --region euca-admin@
services.loadbalancing.worker.keyname = elb-admin
{code}
# Using linked {{cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-vpc-template.json}} template, deployed stack:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-create-stack NginxStack --template-file cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-vpc-template.json --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --parameter ImageId=emi-63ef779d --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --parameter MinSize=3 --parameter MaxSize=6 --region devops-admin@
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@
STACK	NginxStack	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to deploy a 3 availability zone ELB, Nginx deployment on Eucalyptus VPC cloud	2017-02-08T20:23:00.741Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-63ef779d
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	MinSize		3
PARAMETER	MaxSize		6
OUTPUT	AccessLogBucket	nginxstack-s3loggingbucket-ipx6qpuaimhll
OUTPUT	ELBURL	http://NginxStac-NginxELB-VMK9J20VXXDCI-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}
# Gave write access to {{(eucalyptus)loadbalancing}} account:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api put-bucket-acl --bucket nginxstack-s3loggingbucket-ipx6qpuaimhll --grant-write "id=000389956352" --profile devops-admin
[root@h-04 ~]# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket nginxstack-s3loggingbucket-ipx6qpuaimhll --profile devops-admin
{
    "Owner": {
        "DisplayName": "development-operations",
        "ID": "2d4e2b171823f726341a3c41037331c3b10451a5d2821b3b341d10435b574231"
    },
    "Grants": [
        {
            "Grantee": {
                "Type": "CanonicalUser",
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "2d4e2b171823f726341a3c41037331c3b10451a5d2821b3b341d10435b574231"
            },
            "Permission": "FULL_CONTROL"
        },
        {
            "Grantee": {
                "Type": "CanonicalUser",
                "DisplayName": "(eucalyptus)loadbalancing",
                "ID": "3d313f54133b3e148f41635f543c162811a1d3f4f3b501757361a582a339341d"
            },
            "Permission": "WRITE"
        }
    ]
}
{code}
# Described ELB instances using {{(eucalyptus)loadbalancing}} account:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region elb-admin@ --filter tag-value=euca-internal-elb-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB* | grep INST
INSTANCE	i-50e7c0ae	emi-f3290442		euca-192-168-61-58.eucalyptus.internal	running	elb-admin	0		m1.medium	2017-02-08T22:31:24.487Zblack-market				monitoring-enabled		192.168.61.58	vpc-98995982	subnet-c0612255	instance-store					hvm	549e08ce-3c24-4f80-96e5-bc0333d95d89_black-market_1	sg-1eeffa2e			arn:aws:iam::000389956352:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB-VMK9J20VXXDCI	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-f606a569	emi-f3290442		euca-192-168-121-212.eucalyptus.internal	running	elb-admin	0		m1.medium	2017-02-08T20:23:14.398Z	black-dollar				monitoring-enabled		192.168.121.212	vpc-98995982	subnet-3fb11d27	instance-store				hvm		e701906d-e1ea-4747-b229-7245475c91ff_black-dollar_1	sg-1eeffa2e			arn:aws:iam::000389956352:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB-VMK9J20VXXDCI	x86_64
INSTANCE	i-fc774a0f	emi-f3290442		euca-192-168-223-222.eucalyptus.internal	running	elb-admin	0		m1.medium	2017-02-08T20:23:24.451Z	port-of-miami				monitoring-enabled		192.168.223.222	vpc-98995982	subnet-8bdce3dd	instance-store				hvm		5f409685-5afc-4709-88a7-1250802fd52f_port-of-miami_1	sg-1eeffa2e			arn:aws:iam::000389956352:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB-VMK9J20VXXDCI	x86_64
{code}
# Deployed bastion host to access one of the ELB instances using linked {{cfn-bastion-host-vpc.json}} template:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-create-stack ELBBastion --template-file cfn-bastion-host-vpc.json --parameter UbuntuImageId=emi-63ef779d --parameter BastionVPC=vpc-98995982 --parameter ELBInstanceSG=sg-1eeffa2e --parameter BastionSubnet=subnet-d195e0d9 --parameter KeyName=elb-admin --region elb-admin@
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region elb-admin@
STACK	ELBBastion	CREATE_COMPLETE		Cloudformation Template to deploy Bastion host using Ubuntu instance	2017-02-08T21:40:13.562Z
PARAMETER	UbuntuImageId		emi-63ef779d
PARAMETER	SSHLocation		0.0.0.0/0
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	BastionVPC		vpc-98995982
PARAMETER	ELBInstanceSG		sg-1eeffa2e
PARAMETER	BastionSubnet		subnet-d195e0d9
PARAMETER	KeyName		elb-admin
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-7e2ff881
OUTPUT	AZ	port-of-miami
OUTPUT	PublicIP	10.116.152.53
{code}
# SSH'ed into the bastion host, then SSH'd into one of the ELB instances and killed loadbalancer-servo process:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# ssh -i elb-admin-pk ubuntu@10.116.152.53
ubuntu@euca-192-168-1-53:~$ ssh -i elb-admin-pk cloud-user@192.168.121.212
[cloud-user@euca-192-168-121-212]$ sudo -s
[root@@euca-192-168-121-212 cloud-user]$ ps aux | grep servo | grep python | awk '{print $2}' | xargs kill -9
{code}
# Logged into the PostgresDB and checked {{eucalyptus_loadbalancing}} relation for the {{metadata_activity_failure_count}} attribute in the {{metadata_servo_instance}} table.  Waited till it hit 24:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# psql -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data -p 8777 eucalyptus_shared
psql (9.2.18)
Type "help" for help.

eucalyptus_shared=# set search_path to eucalyptus_loadbalancing;
SET
eucalyptus_shared=# select metadata_activity_failure_count from metadata_servo_instance;
 metadata_activity_failure_count
---------------------------------


                               2
                               0
(4 rows)
...
eucalyptus_shared=# select metadata_activity_failure_count from metadata_servo_instance;
 metadata_activity_failure_count
---------------------------------


                              22
                               0
(4 rows)

eucalyptus_shared=# select metadata_activity_failure_count from metadata_servo_instance;
 metadata_activity_failure_count
---------------------------------


                               0
                              24
(4 rows)

eucalyptus_shared=# \q
{code}
# Check to see if the ELB instance was shutting down, and had been replaced:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region elb-admin@ --filter tag-value=euca-internal-elb-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB* | grep 192.168.121.212
INSTANCE	i-f606a569	emi-f3290442		euca-192-168-121-212.eucalyptus.internal	shutting-down	elb-admin	0		m1.medium	2017-02-08T20:23:14.398Z	black-dollar				monitoring-enabled		192.168.121.212	vpc-98995982	subnet-3fb11d27	instance-store		    	hvm		e701906d-e1ea-4747-b229-7245475c91ff_black-dollar_1	sg-1eeffa2e			arn:aws:iam::000389956352:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB-VMK9J20VXXDCI	x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-9aef775d	subnet-3fb11d27	vpc-98995982	000389956352	in-use	192.168.121.212		true
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	192.168.121.212		primary
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region elb-admin@ --filter tag-value=euca-internal-elb-000727120439-NginxStac-NginxELB* | grep 192.168.121.212

*Note* While doing the test, I ran curl against the ELB DNS name.  I noticed that there was about a minute and a half pause between responses during the period that the ELB instance was terminated, and replaced by a new instance:
{code}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.10.0 (Ubuntu)
Date: Wed, 08 Feb 2017 22:55:36 GMT
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 413598
Last-Modified: Wed, 08 Feb 2017 20:25:10 GMT

Accept-Ranges: bytes

[~spark], I had an ELB instance in each AZ.  When one of the ELB instances was terminated, I noticed that my curl traffic paused for around a minute and a half.  Is  there anything that can be done to minimize this delay?
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
